DataElement.preferredName: IWQOL-Lite 7 Past Week How True Because of My Weight Have Trouble Crossing Legs Score How True 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation in the past week about how true it is that they have trouble crossing their legs because of their weight, using a 5 point Likert scale. Â

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Impact of Weight on Quality of Life-Lite Past Week How True Because of My Weight Have Trouble Crossing Legs Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 31-item, self-report questionnaire that utilizes a five-point rating scale to measure obesity-specific quality of life in adults. The assessment consists of a total score, as well as individual scores for each of five specific domains, including physical function, self-esteem, sexual life, public distress, and work._The most recent week. May include the present day._A question about an individual's agreement with a statement._A question about the effects of an individual's weight._A question about whether an individual has or had trouble crossing legs._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Impact of Weight on Quality of Life-Lite

The assessment consists of a total score, as well as individual scores for each of five specific domains, including physical function, self-esteem, sexual life, public distress, and work.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Because of my weight I have t
ReferenceDocuments.description: Because of my weight I have trouble crossing my legs.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Impact of Weight on Quality of Life (IWQOL-Lite)
